Description: Pottery ostracon with practice text. Now joined to EA18816
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Sheikh Abd el-Qurna (Thebes), Monastery of Epiphanius, see curator's comments. (said to have come from Karnak.)
Curator's comments: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 29:2 physically joins O.Mon.Epiph. 576, which the 1913/1914 MMA Expedition was discovered in the East Buildings (in and around MMA 808) of the Monastery of Epiphanius. Attached to 1887,0402.221
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.36, pl.29)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.42)
Cribiore 1996 / Writing, teachers, and students on Graeco-Roman Egypt (no. 34)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (65422) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/65422)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 29:2 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 39 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
